definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: Saadi, perhaps the best-known brother, captained the national soccer team.
sentences.chinese: 可能最聲明遠揚是薩阿迪，國家足球隊隊長。

sentences.english: It was then that Mac's special skills started to blossom.
sentences.chinese: 也就是從這時起，“夥計”獨有的技藝開始聲名遠揚。

sentences.english: Some small traders at this tourist spot are notorious for their overcharging customers.
sentences.chinese: 這個旅遊景點的一些小商販以宰客而臭名遠揚。

sentences.english: That wizened and grotesque little old man is a notorious miser.
sentences.chinese: 那個乾癟難看的小老頭是個臭名遠揚的吝嗇鬼。

sentences.english: It is famous for its high altitude and imposing scenery.
sentences.chinese: 納木錯以其高海拔和令人窒息的美景而聲名遠揚。

sentences.english: But the novelty of being famous for being bad was wearing off, and even now.
sentences.chinese: 但臭名遠揚的新奇感逐漸消失了，即便是現在。

sentences.english: Who would really want to be an insider?
sentences.chinese: 又有誰真的願意聲名遠揚？

sentences.english: China is notorious for its algae blooms.
sentences.chinese: 中國藻華氾濫早已“臭名遠揚”。

sentences.english: Pride breakfasted with plenty, dined with poverty, supped with infamy.
sentences.chinese: 驕傲的人先是富足，而後貧窮，而後惡名遠揚。

definition: to acclaim/to sing the praises of
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
